info.title: Advanced Data Operations
info.description: A suite of advanced operations designed to assist in the transformation of bulk datasets.

post.description: Aggregate one or more properties by a grouped set of fields within a JSON array dataset.
Perform a Cartesian join over two or more datasets.
Concatenate a field from an array of objects into a single string output.
Evaluates a C# expression and returns the result.
Takes in and executes a C# script.
Transform a comma separated table of data into an array of JSON objects.
Select a set of distinct property values from an array of objects.
Execute a SQL statement over one or more supplied datasets.
Filter an array of complex, multi-level objects by one or more properties contained within each item in the array.
Flatten an array of complex, multi-level objects into an array of single JSON objects.
Get the schema (i.e. properties and their associated types) from an array of objects.
Compress a stream of text into a GZip archive.
Decompress a GZip archive into a base64 string.
Join exactly two datasets using a left or inner join technique.
Validates a JSON schema using more advanced functionality than standard.
Transform a JSON structure into a tabular format.
Transform a JSON array of objects into a tab delimited text format.
Transform a JSON array of objects into a comma separated table format.

post.summary: Json Properties to Name Value Pair Array
post.description: Transform a JSON structure to name/value pairs.
Use the Levenshtein Distance algorithm to calculate a set of ratios for indicating how similar two strings are to each other.
Transform a base64 encoded parquet dataset into an array of JSON objects.
Produce a set of matches for a string using a regular expression pattern.
Concatenate an array of values into a delimited string.
Provide a distinct set of values from an array.
Sort an array of complex, multi-level objects by one or more properties contained within each item in the array.
Split all objects contained within an array by a defined criteria.
Transform a tab delimited textual dataset into an array of JSON objects.
Transform a set of properties in a dataset using any of the available custom transformation functions.
Transform an XML structure to JSON using XPath statements and any of the 100+ custom transformation functions provided by the framework.
Decompress a Zip archive into a list of files with content (if requested).

200.description: File listing retrieved from the zip archive.

name.description: The name of the file or folder.
name.title: Name

path.description: The full path of the file or folder.
path.title: Path

compressedSize.description: The size of the file in its compressed state.
compressedSize.title: Compressed Size

uncompressedSize.description: The size of the file in its uncompressed state.
uncompressedSize.title: Uncompressed Size

fileContent.description: A base64 representation of the file content.
fileContent.title: File Content

filter.description: String based WHERE clause used to filter the returned result set.
filter.title: Filter

sortOrder.description: Object with one or more field names and the sorting direction (i.e. ASC or DESC).
sortOrder.title: Sort Order

schema.description: Manual schema override to force an incoming field to a specific primitive type.
schema.title: Schema

singleTable.description: Array of single-level objects with one or more properties.
singleTable.title: Data

complexSingleTable.description: Array of complex objects or arrays.
complexSingleTable.title: Data

multipleTables.description: Defines multiple datasets by the way of an object with each property value being an array of objects.  Each property name is the name of a dataset that is able to be referenced by way of the operation being undertaken.
multipleTables.title: Data

separator.description: The string used to delimit the resulting concatenated string.
separator.title: Separator

cultureName.description: Allows the calling application to change the culture so date parsing, etc. produces the correct result.
cultureName.title: Culture Name

isBoolean.description: List of properties in the output that should be treated as boolean values
isBoolean.title: Boolean Properties

items.title: Aggregate By
items.description: The fields to aggregate by (i.e. the non-numeric properties).

items.title: Aggregate On
items.description: The fields to aggregate on (i.e. the numeric properties).

field.description: Field from the source data set to concatenate.
field.title: Field

expression.description: The C# expression that will be evaluated.
expression.title: C# Expression

script.description: The C# script that will be executed.
script.title: C# Script

classDefinitions.description: An array of class definitions that are able to be referenced from the script.
classDefinitions.title: Class Definitions

parameters.description: Parameters used to pass into and be consumed by the script.
parameters.title: Parameters

fields.description: The list of fields to include in the result set.  Supports the dynamic field selection syntax.
fields.title: Fields

query.description: Fully functioning SELECT statement that refers to and processes the incoming data set.
query.title: Query String

filter.description: Filter expression as defined by the documentation.
filter.title: Filter Expression

sortOrder.description: Object with one or more field names and the sorting direction (i.e. ASC or DESC).
sortOrder.title: Sort Order

data.description: The JSON data to be transformed.
data.title: JSON Data

delimiter.description: The string used to delimit each property from the different levels in the object hierarchy.
delimiter.title: Delimiter

balancedOutput.title: Balanced Output
balancedOutput.description: If TRUE, each item in the result set will have the same set of properties, therefore, making it balanced.  Filter and Sort Order only work if this is set to TRUE.

data.description: The string of data to archive using the GZip format.
data.title: Data

data.description: A base64 representation of the GZip file to decompress.
data.title: Data

data.description: A base64 representation of the zip archive to decompress.
data.title: Data

getFileContents.description: Retrieve the contents of each file?
getFileContents.title: Get File Contents

joinFields.description: The list of fields to join each table on.
joinFields.title: Join Fields

fields.description: The list of fields to include in the result set.  Supports the dynamic field selection syntax.
fields.title: Fields

forceFullyQualifiedFieldNames.description: Force all field names in the resulting dataset to be prefixed with the originating dataset name.
forceFullyQualifiedFieldNames.title: Force Fully Qualified Field Names

data.description: Text to perform the regex pattern over
data.title: Data

items.title: Data
items.description: Array of strings or numeric values.

field.description: Field to perform the distinct on.
field.title: Field

splits.description: Array of single level objects defined by a destination field mapped from a source field or a constant.
splits.title: Splits

transformations.description: Object containing a source and destination set of mapping transformations.
transformations.title: Transformations

preserveAllProperties.title: Preserve All Properties
preserveAllProperties.description: If TRUE, all properties not specifically called out in the transformations property will be preserved in the resulting dataset.

rowSeparator.description: The character(s) separating each row, default = \n
rowSeparator.title: Row Separator

delimiter.description: The character(s) separating each column, default = ,
delimiter.title: Delimiter

escapeCharacter.description: The escape character to use when splitting each field, default is double quotes.
escapeCharacter.title: Escape Character

encoding.description: The encoding of the file content, default = UTF8.
encoding.title: Encoding

rowSeparator.description: The character(s) separating each row, default = \n
rowSeparator.title: Row Separator

delimiter.description: The character(s) separating each column, default = \t
delimiter.title: Delimiter

encoding.description: The encoding of the file content, default = UTF8.
encoding.title: Encoding

path.description: JToken path used for initial selection (default = $)
path.title: Path

balancedOutput.title: Balanced Output
balancedOutput.description: If TRUE, each item in the result set will have the same set of properties, therefore, making it balanced.

rowSeparator.description: The character(s) separating each row, default = \n
rowSeparator.title: Row Separator

rowSeparator.description: The character(s) separating each row, default = \n
rowSeparator.title: Row Separator

escapeCharacter.description: The escape character for values that contain the field separator value.
escapeCharacter.title: Escape Character

validateOnly.description: Validate data only, do not return any data.
validateOnly.title: Validate Only

skip.description: The amount of records to SKIP before applying the TAKE parameter.
skip.title: Skip

take.description: The amount of records to TAKE after the records that were skipped.
take.title: Take

data.description: Base64 encoded string containing contents of a parquet data file.
data.title: Data

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: The schema that the JSON will be validated against.

data.description: JSON object that will be used to validate against the schema.
data.title: JSON Object

primaryLoopAtElement.description: XPath statement selecting a set of elements to loop over.
primaryLoopAtElement.title: Primary Loop at Element

map.description: Json object containing properties with values that map to source using XPath statements.
map.title: Map Object

subLoopAtElements.description: Sub map XML elements to loop over so as to provide a header and detail structure.
subLoopAtElements.title: Sub Loop at Elements

mapName.description: The name used to distinguished this map from others.
mapName.title: Map Name

xPathQuery.description: XPath statement selecting a set of elements to loop over.
xPathQuery.title: XPath Query

map.description: Json object containing properties with values that map to source using XPath statements.
map.title: Map Object

baseValue.description: The base value to compare all other values against.
baseValue.title: Base Value

comparisonValues.description: The base value to compare all other values against.
comparisonValues.title: Comparison Values

ratioThreshold.description: A number between 0 and 100. If left blank, the default value will be 0, i.e. all results are returned.
ratioThreshold.title: Ratio Threshold

applyRatioThresholdTo.description: Apply the threshold filter to the maximum ratio returned in the data set or the average of all included.
applyRatioThresholdTo.title: Ratio Threshold

ratioSelectionType.description: The type of ratios you want to perform each comparison for.
ratioSelectionType.title: Ratio Selection Type

tokenSortType.description: The selection for sorting each word/token prior to comparison or not.
tokenSortType.title: Token Sort Type

caseSensitive.description: Run the comparisons in a case sensitive way or not.
caseSensitive.title: Case Sensitive

removeWhitespace.description: Remove or keep all spaces prior to comparison.
removeWhitespace.title: Remove Whitespace

removeSpecialCharacters.description: Remove or keep all special characters prior to comparison.
removeSpecialCharacters.title: Remove Special Characters
